verses.verse: (The Return of the Redeemed to Zion) (Isa 51.3; 55.12) The wilderness and the dry land shall be glad; the desert shall rejoice and blossom; like the crocus

(v 10|ISA 35:10; Isa 25.9; 32.15; 60.13) it shall blossom abundantly and rejoice with joy and shouting. The glory of Lebanon shall be given to it, the majesty of Carmel and Sharon. They shall see the glory of the LORD, the majesty of our God.]]
(Job 4.3, 4; Heb 12.12) Strengthen the weak hands and make firm the feeble knees.
(Ps 145.19; Isa 1.24; 34.8) Say to those who are of a fearful heart, “Be strong, do not fear! Here is your God. He will come with vengeance, with terrible recompense. He will come and save you.”
(Isa 29.18; Mt 11.5; Jn 9.6, 7) Then the eyes of the blind shall be opened, and the ears of the deaf shall be opened;

(Isa 41.18; 43.19; Mt 9.32; 15.30; Jn 5.8, 9; 7.38; Acts 3.8) then the lame shall leap like a deer, and the tongue of the speechless sing for joy. For waters shall break forth in the wilderness and streams in the desert;

(Isa 34.13; 49.10) the burning sand shall become a pool and the thirsty ground springs of water; the haunt of jackals shall become a swamp; (Cn: Heb in the haunt of jackals is her resting place) the grass shall become reeds and rushes.

(Isa 62.10; Jer 14.8; Mt 7.13, 14) A highway shall be there, (Q ms Gk Syr: MT A highway and a way shall be there) and it shall be called the Holy Way; the unclean shall not travel on it, (Or pass it by) but it shall be for God’s people; (Cn: Heb for them) no traveler, not even fools, shall go astray.
(Isa 30.6; 34.14; 62.12) No lion shall be there, nor shall any ravenous beast come up on it; they shall not be found there, but the redeemed shall walk there.

(Isa 25.8; 51.11; 65.19; Rev 7.17; 21.4) And the ransomed of the LORD shall return and come to Zion with singing; everlasting joy shall be upon their heads; they shall obtain joy and gladness, and sorrow and sighing shall flee away.
